prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Letter and Newsclipping of Frances Newman, Accession #8294-a , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p:
Letter was found in Rare Books volume, PS 3527 .E883Z5 1929.
Clipping was found in Rare Books volume, PS 3527 .E883Z5 1929.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was transfered from the Rare Book Division on June 9, 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a letter [1928?] April 13, Newman writes to Edith Booth to arrange a meeting in Paris.
With the letter is a newsclipping, 1929, discussing the career and death of Frances Newman and the book "Frances Newman's Letters."

did.unittitle: Frances Newman, Paris, France, to Edith [Mrs. Edwin] Booth, [New York City] [1928?] Apr 13
did.physdesc: 2 p., on 1 l., with envelope, ALS

scopecontent.p: Asks Booth to contact her at the Bankers Trust Company address when she knows when she will be coming to Paris because she wants to see her.
re career and death of Frances Newman, which also discusses the book Frances Newman's Lettersby Hansell Baugh
